techmeme.title: An excerpt from the book Dark Wire, which details how the biggest FBI sting operation ran the Anøm encrypted phone network to catch criminals like "Microsoft" (Joseph Cox/Wired)
A profile of CoreWeave, as the cloud GPU provider reveals plans to build three European data centers for $2.2B and repurpose several Core Scientific facilities (Tim Bradshaw/Financial Times)
YouTube, the only major US platform available in Russia, has become a primary source of entertainment for many Russians, making a ban tricky for the Kremlin (Justin Ling/Wired)
Australia's eSafety commissioner ends the legal action asking X to remove a video of a clergyman's stabbing; Musk labelled the action an assault on free speech (Simon Sharwood/The Register)
Singapore-based Nium, a B2B cross-border payments infrastructure provider, raised $50M at a $1.4B valuation, down from $2B in 2022, as the firm eyes a 2025 IPO (Ryan Browne/CNBC)
